alert.note: Alert for White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 23 at 2:11AM MST until January 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Periods of snow will continue for the next 24 hours. Snow could be locally heavy later this morning and again this evening, slowly tapering off early Wednesday morning. Heavier showers may produce an inch two of new snow in a short time frame, but may also melt off between showers. * WHERE...Portions of the White Mountain region above 7000 feet, including Alpine, Greer and McNary. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult at times within the heavier snow showers. Additional snow forecast from 2 AM Today to 5 AM Wednesday: Alpine 3 to 5 inches Pinetop-Lkside 1 to 2 inches Show Low 0 to 1 inches Whiteriver 0 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
